qas.question: In what century did the Gothic style first flourish?
In what century did the Gothic style cease to be used?
Along with Reims, where is a notable Gothic cathedral in France located?
What is a notable English Gothic cathedral?
Among which builders was the Gothic style first used?

context: From the early <a0_0>12th<a0_0/> century, <a4_0>French<a4_0/> builders developed the Gothic style, marked by the use of rib vaults, pointed arches, flying buttresses, and large stained glass windows. It was used mainly in churches and cathedrals, and continued in use until the <a1_0>16th<a1_0/> century in much of Europe. Classic examples of Gothic architecture include <a2_0>Chartres<a2_0/> Cathedral and Reims Cathedral in France as well as <a3_0>Salisbury Cathedral<a3_0/> in England. Stained glass became a crucial element in the design of churches, which continued to use extensive wall-paintings, now almost all lost.
